title: National Oilwell Varco Shares Rise
text:
By Dave Sebastian

Shares of National Oilwell Varco Inc. (NOV) rose 12.4% Tuesday after the company on Monday posted its third-quarter results.

For the quarter ended Sept. 30, adjusted earnings before interest, taxes depreciation and amortization were $262 million, up from $245 million in the prior year. Analysts polled by FactSet were looking for $213 million.

"In the third quarter, adjusted EBITDA improved significantly relative to second quarter results due to accelerating cost reductions, a favorable revenue shift towards higher-margin offshore and aftermarket businesses, and positive project close-out variances," Chief Executive Clay Williams said in prepared remarks Monday.

However, the oil-field service company reported a loss of $244 million, or 64 cents a share, compared with a profit of $1 million, or breakeven on a per-share basis, in the same quarter last year. Analysts were looking for a profit of 12 cents a share.

Revenue ticked down to $2.13 billion from $2.15 billion in the previous year. Analysts were expecting $2.17 billion.
